means: 小行星( asteroid的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: Asteroids, also known as " minor planets ", are numerous in the outer space.
sentence.Network_cn: 小行星, 亦称为 “ 小型行星 ”, 在外太空中不计其数.

sentence.Network_en: Most stars probably have their quota of planets, meteorids, comets, and asteroids.
sentence.Network_cn: 多数恒星也许还拥有若干行星 、 流星 、 彗星和小行星.

sentence.Network_en: Planets, asteroids, and satellites shine only by reflected sunlight.
sentence.Network_cn: 行星 、 小行星和卫星都是靠反射太阳光而发光的.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 海泥 sea mud海盘车；小行星 asteroids海泡蛇纹岩 porcellanous serpentine(porcellophite).

because the chondritic asteroids formed after the chondrules did , the initial 26Al to 27Al ratio in chondrules places an limit on the amount of 26Al that was available to heat the rocky bodies .因为球粒陨石小行星是在球粒之后形成，球粒中铝26对铝27的初始比值，决定了能够用来加热石质天体的铝26含量的上限。

the new definition distinguishes planets , which dynamically dominate a large volume of orbital space , from asteroids , KBOs and ejected planetary embryos , which do not .新的定义界定出，行星在动力上支配了大范围的轨道空间，但小行星、KBO以及遭逐出的行星胚胎则没有。
tip : refineries can exploit owned and adjacent resource asteroids . asteroids can only support so many refineries at a time though .小贴士：精炼船能采集起所处的和周围的资源小行星上的资源。但是小行星一次只能供给很少的精炼船。

entry.tran: 小行星（在火星及木星轨道间围绕太阳运行）
entry.def: An asteroid is one of the very small planets that move around the sun between Mars and Jupiter.
